Package Contents

Back

 

Unless otherwise specified, the VXLIB package installs under C:\ti\ in directory vxlib_c66x_1_1_3_0. The files that comprise the VXLIB installation can be categorized into the following categories.

  1. Documentation
  2. Component Repository
  3. Kernel Directories
  4. Library Directory
  5. Eclipse Support
  6. Internal Meta Data

The sections that follow provide details for each category.

 

Documentation

Installation places all VXLIB documentation in a Docs directory in the VXLIB root. The following documentation comes with the delivery:

  • VXLIB_Users_Manual.html (this document)
  • Release Notes
  • Software Manifest
  • Cycle Benchmarks

 

Component Repository

The installation creates a Components directory in the VXLIB root folder. This directory serves as a repository for all packages included in the VXLIB installation. Each package in this repository is compressed.

 

Kernel Directories

The installation also creates a Packages directory in the VXLIB root folder. This directory holds all kernels contained within the VXLIB library. This directory follows the standard TI directory structure. As an example, the files that comprise the VXLIB kernel VXLIB_box_3x3_i8u_o8u will be located, relative to the VXLIB root installation directory, at packages/ti/vxlib/src/vx/VXLIB_box_3x3_i8u_o8u/.

Each Kernel is delivered with a pre-compiled CCS project that illustrates the kernel API and performs several validation tests. Each project provides an estimate of kernel cycle and program memory requirements.

Some selected kernels also contain a bam_plugin folder which contains the files necessary to plugin the respective kernel into the BAM block based processing framework.

Follow Individual Kernel Build Procedure for building & testing kernel projects.

 

Library Directory

The installation also creates a lib directory in the packages/ti/vxlib folder. This directory holds:
  • vxlib.lib : Main optimized vxlib library
  • vxlib_cn.lib : C Natural Implementation of vxlib library
  • vxlib_bamplugin.lib : Library of bam plugin interfaces to the VXLIB functions.
  • common.lib : Common functions required for testing kernels.

  • vxlib.a86 : Host(x86) Intrinsic library
  • vxlib_cn.a86 : C Natural Host(x86) library
  • vxlib_bamplugin.a86 : Host(x86) Library of bam plugin interfaces to the VXLIB functions.
  • common.a86 : Common functions Host(x86) library.

  • vxlib.a86_64W : Host(x86_64) Intrinsic library
  • vxlib_cn.a86_64W : C Natural Host(x86_64) library
  • vxlib_bamplugin.a86_64W : Host(x86_64) Library of bam plugin interfaces to the VXLIB functions.
  • common.a86_64W : Common functions Host(x86_64) library.

The *.lib files are actually "library information archives" (build from using libinfo6x command) which internally point to the *.ae66 library files. This is done so that you can always link using the *.lib files even if we add new variants of libraries with different extensions to the package. You can read more about Library Information Archiver tool in spru186

Eclipse Support

The Eclipse directory contains all files required for VXLIB to be recognized by Eclipse (CCS) as a plug-in. This is a support directory and can be safely ignored.

 

Internal Meta Data

The VXLIB installation creates a Package directory. This directory contains meta information required by the TI packaging tools. This is a support directory and can be safely ignored.
